title: perf(es/hygiene): Fix performance bug
body:
swc_ecma_transforms_base:
 - `hygiene`: Skip checking a symbol if we are sure that it will be discarded.

swc_ecma_laoder:
 - Optimize `NodeModulesResolver` by trying `.js` first.

title: fix(es/loader): Prefer ESM
body:
swc_ecma_loader:
 - Check for `module` field and prefer it over `main`.

title: ci(actions): include swc_cli into optional deps package
body:
<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->

**Description:**
This PR continues CLI implementation, update publish script to each platform specific optional dep to include cli binary as well. Main entrypoint (@swc/cli) and optional dep doesn't point to those binary yet, so this is safe from any breaking changes. 

To conform with existing artifact packaging I did small bend over to copy release binary into specific platform path side by side to node bindings.

**Related issue (if exists):**

- https://github.com/swc-project/swc/issues/1589

title: chore(scripts): Use `cargo profile instruments` instead of `cargo instruments`
body: `cargo profile instruments` invokes cargo using CLI, so cache is not removed while `cargo instruments` wipes cache because it invokes cargo directly and cargo itself does not respect `rust-toolchain`

title: fix(ecma/transform): export destructured properties in TypeScript namespace
feat(node): update features check
body:
<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->

**Description:**

This PR contains two proposals.

First, move feature checks to build script. The `compile_error` error message won't be mixed with other errors that are consequences. What do you think of that ?

Second, add a check that insures that features `swc_v1` and `swc_v2` are not being used at the same time.

<!-- Explain the **motivation** for making this change. What existing problem does the pull request solve? -->

**Related issue (if exists):**

https://github.com/swc-project/swc/issues/3079

title: test(es/codegen): Add some tests for sourcemap
Add js extension to preset-env generated polyfill imports
chore(repo): Make `git` faster
body:
swc_ecma_parser:
 - Flatten parser test suite ported from `tsc`.

swc:
 - Flatten the reference directory for the `tsc` test suite.

title: feat(es/preset-env): add ES2022 features to `preset-env`
body:
<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->

**Description:**

<!-- Explain the **motivation** for making this change. What existing problem does the pull request solve? -->

- Format `transform_data_bugfixes.json` with indent space 4
- Add script to generate `transform_data.json` from `@babel/compat-data`
- Add ES2022 features (`proposal-class-static-block` and `proposal-private-property-in-object`)

**BREAKING CHANGE:**

<!--
If this PR introduces a breaking change, it must contain a notice for it to be included in the CHANGELOG. Add description or remove entirely if not breaking.

You may need to update `MIGRATION.md` for the breaking changes.
-->

**Related issue (if exists):**

title: feat(swc/cli): setup packages for binary
feat(es/preset-env): Upgrade `browserslist-rs`
body:
Upgraded `browserslist-rs`.

## Features

- Added support of `throwOnMissing` option which is introduced since Browserslist v4.19.
- Added support of querying percentage by region, such as `> 1% in CN`.

## Fixes

- Query which starts with `not` can be detected and reports error.
- Renamed WebAssembly entry to avoid collision.

title: fix(es/transforms/compat): transform optional eval call to indirect eval call
fix(es/parser): SyntaxError for `export type * from "mod";`
body:
<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->

**Description:**

<!-- Explain the **motivation** for making this change. What existing problem does the pull request solve? -->

Following TypeScript programs are invalid ([Playground link](https://www.typescriptlang.org/play?#code/KYDwDg9gTgLgBDAnmYcBUcCGBnOAjTKOAMyggFs4AiAqKgbgChRJYFlUNSLraHGgA)):

```ts
export type * as bar from "mod";
```

```ts
export type * from "mod";
```

But swc TypeScript parser allows the code.

**BREAKING CHANGE:**
<!--
If this PR introduces a breaking change, it must contain a notice for it to be included in the CHANGELOG. Add description or remove entirely if not breaking.

You may need to update `MIGRATION.md` for the breaking changes.
-->

N/A

**Related issue (if exists):**

N/A

title: Fix #2461: Update decorator design:type so the outputted metadata for union types is consistent with Typescript
body:

Updates the decorator `design:type` so the outputted metadata for union types is consistent with Typescript

This is my first time using `rust` so 🤞 the code isn't too horrible 😬

Nothing.

title: feat(es/lints): Implement simple validations
body:

 - Initialze.
 - Implement `const-assign`. (Closes #2016)
 - Implement `duplicate-bindings`. (Closes #2795)
 - Implement `duplicate-exports`. (Closes #3056)

swc:
 - Use linter.
